description.narrative: By 2016, policy makers, society, media, families, children and adolescents have access to improved knowledge on the situation of children and adolescents, including disaggregated data (by gender, race, age, geographic location), evidence on major inequality factors and monitoring data in emergency situations, which they can use to provide and/or demand actions that contribute to the realisation of children's rights.

sector.narrative: Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
HQ and RO technical support to multiple Goal Areas
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Development Partner affairs Technical staff services
Other General Services other general services
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Citizen engagement and participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Brazil (Policies Monitoring and Cooperations)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, policy makers, society, media, families, children and adolescents have access to improved knowledge on the situation of children and adolescents, including disaggregated data (by gender, race, age, geographic location), evidence on major inequality factors and monitoring data in emergency situations, which they can use to provide and/or demand actions that contribute to the realisation of children's rights.

description.narrative: In 2016, MXE focused on: i) new CP, where knowledge management played a key role; ii) data analysis for UNICEF Seal and PCU; iii) response to Aedes aegypty and Zika; iv) support to capacity development in equity-focused MXE and data analysis; v) dissemination of knowledge on children's rights in Brazil. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of studies, research and surveys generating improved data in key areas to tackle inequalities (e.g. out of school children, HIV/AIDS, violence, adolescent participation, etc.)

actual.value: 2016:Two studies completed in 2016: - Qualitative study series on knowledge, attitude and practices related to Zika virus and Aedes aegypti, - Qualitative analysis of determinants for adolescent pregnancy.

title.narrative: Number of knowledge products created or updated by UNICEF to facilitate access to and use of up-to-date, disaggregated data on the situation of children and adolescents and on inequalities

target.value: 2016:1 new product or update per year

actual.value:
2016:Achieved.
Three knowledge products completed in 2016: - Situation Analysis of Brazilian Children and Adolescents, - Chapter on The Girl Child: a situation of progress and challenges for girls in Brazil 20 years after Beijing, - Data sets: final indicator and inequality reduction analysis for ei

title.narrative: Number of programmes, products and initiatives developed by partners with UNICEF's support, related to the improvement of disaggregated data, particularly on inequalities, including emergency monitoring systems.

baseline.value: Contributions are offered on a regular basis

actual.value: 2016:2 programmes/initiatives: - Disability data collection: helping IBGE adequate to international standards, - Birth registration: support to partners' initiative to measure and eradicate under-registration, especially among indigenous children,

title.narrative: Existence of an integrated knowledge management strategy in UNICEF Brazil, in line with the country's needs and with the UN community
